meanings.definition: The condition of being weak or delicate.
meanings.sent1: Her frailty made it difficult for her to carry heavy bags.
meanings.sent2: The kitten's frailty was evident in its tiny, fragile body.
meanings.sent3: Despite his frailty, the old man insisted on climbing the stairs himself.
meanings.sent4: The frailty of the bridge was exposed when a heavy truck crossed it.
meanings.sent5: The frailty of the flower petals reminded her of the fleeting nature of beauty.

meanings.definition: A fault or flaw that makes someone or something vulnerable.
meanings.sent1: The frailty in the lock allowed the thief to easily break in.
meanings.sent2: His biggest frailty was his inability to resist temptation.
meanings.sent3: The frailty in the plan became apparent when it started raining.
meanings.sent4: The frailty in the system was exploited by hackers to gain unauthorized access.
meanings.sent5: The frailty in the armor left the knight exposed to enemy attacks.

meanings.sent1: His frailty for flattery often led him to make poor decisions.
meanings.sent2: She recognized her own frailty in succumbing to jealousy.
meanings.sent3: The villain's frailty for power drove him to commit heinous acts.
meanings.sent4: The frailty of greed consumed the once honest man.
meanings.sent5: The frailty of pride blinded him to the consequences of his actions.
